snippet: A plan to build affordable housing on leftover lots is drawing protests from the people who may need it most.
abstract: New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development makes plans to allow building of affordable housing on 181 vacant lots, 20 of which are occupied by community gardens; garden organizers, who have signed interim-use agreements and must vacate on demand, protest choice of their lots over hundreds of others that are empty; Mayor Bill de Blasio promises to asses each neighborhood's needs when deciding which lots should be developed.
lead_paragraph: A plan to build affordable housing on leftover lots is drawing protests from the people who may need it most.

headline.print_headline: In Community Gardens, a New Weed?
headline.main: In Community Gardens, a New Weed?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
